title: terrible follow through
body: I am absolutely appalled by the service at Strawberry Hill Medical Centre. I have had a sprained ankle for a significant amount of time. They  prepared an ultrasound referral and when I contacted the hospital to schedule my appointment they told me on 22 Mar that it would take 5 weeks and to call back. So I called the hospital today (21 Apr) and they said they rejected the referral on 25 Mar (I should get an MRI instead) and sent it back to Strawberry Hill on that date. But I had no idea about this because no one ever contacted me to let me know and the referral was never modified. Unbelievable.

title: Brilliant Practice
body: It was very helpful to receive a follow up call regarding a previous appointment. A new appointment was booked. On day of appointment, GP gave time to explain, listened and made helpful suggestions. Medication was available to collect a few hours later. You can’t fault this. 10/10

author: astrophe 73
title: A person centred approach
body:
I write in praise of the Oldham Family Practice, a surgery that I happily recommend. All of the staff are extremely helpful and caring. Whether by telephone or a surgery visit, patients are welcomed by cheerful and friendly members of staff. The G.Ps offer a person-centred approach where I feel I'm being seen as an individual, NOT as the ' 9:15'  
At my age I've seen a few surgeries with battle-axe guard dogs on reception !  
This practice is the best I have ever been with, it is excellent !

author: Rosiedog
title: Phone consultations
body: Not usually so bad but call booked for 2. 15pm and finally rang at 5. 15pm. I mean 3 hours. It's ridiculous. Good job I'd nothing pressing for this afternoon. Plus not sounding interested springs to mind.

author: librarm76
title: The care has been very good
body:
I have found the care very good and have found the staff very understanding. I have found that the nurses do understand me. If they ask me to try something, I always answer I'll do my best.  
All members of staff have been very patient with me. I appreciate the feedback on my progress.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: stareq65
title: A brilliant job
body:
I have been attending the leg ulcer clinic for a while and just wanted to say they deliver an excellent service, they are so caring, kind, helpful, thoughtful and do a brilliant job.  
The two nurses are both called Claire and they are amazing. Thank you to you all.

title: DR's and other staff were nice, reception staff…
body:
I was sat in the waiting area, where there was three reception staff, one middle aged one started the conversation about a patient in the waiting area looking agitated, very agitated (there was no one in there looking agitated), she then started to say this agitated person's daughter was in care. 
There was no confidentiality and all this was said reasonably loud, I was quite disgusted in them speaking out loudly about this and she clearly had no regards for anyone in the room or to who she was referring to, quite rude and unprofessional. Even a male in front of me was looking at them and then shaking his head. Not a conversation patients wanted to hear being discussed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

author: Nett
title: Poor service at my GP
body: Hi, I've been begging for help with my mental health from my GP practice and I feel I'm being ignored. I've been waiting for a diagnosis for a 9 month chronic hip pain. I'm at my wits end and this practice constantly makes me feel like I'm bothering them and I'm an inconvenience. I have suffered with my mental health for years and it can get really bad. I have to chase up results, blood tests and also call backs are not done by the book. I received a call back after I requested it. Due to driving I missed it and received a txt 1 minute later asking if I still needed to see a practitioner to call back and re-book. I've always been told they try 3 times. It's not acceptable to treat people this way.

author: WorriedK
title: Terrible wait for appointments
body: 2 abnormal blood tests, second worse than first and I have to wait 4 weeks before I can discuss with a Doctor (over the phone). Just hope its not serious? ? ? Absolutely disgusted by this wait.

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: Kinetix
title: Our Son's Journey
body:
We arrived at BGH in the early morning . We were then prepped for theater for 9am and briefed by our lead surgeon and the anesthetist.  
There were many NHS team members in theatre. Due to the moment, I didn’t keep track of all of their names but they all were amazing!!! Very friendly, helpful and professional.  
My partner mentioned the spinal tap was done perfectly as she hardly felt pain, the effects took place almost instantly. Throughout the surgery, the anaesthetist was very friendly, attentive and most of all kept us informed as to what was going on and what to expect whilst administering medication though out the procedure. Looked after us like a hawk and was on top of any situation when it happened. Allowed my partner to be conscious and part of seeing our son’s birth which had not been possible for her during our daughter’s birth.  
The staff member from SCBU was so friendly and it was lovely to have small talk while we waited for our son's arrival. I then knew he was in good hands as he needed some extra care (I was given the terminology but I confess I could not comprehend it), then explained that he needed to go to the SCBU unit and I was given the choice to either stay with with my partner or join them. She requested that I stayed with her.  
There was a brief moment (which was later explained in detail) where there was a tense moment during the operation. I felt the tension in the room, however this is where the professionalism of the surgical team started to shine, at no moment did I panic as I knew that the situation was under control.  
I have a very inquisitive mind and wanted to see the details of the operation which I’m sure is a little uncommon however I was allowed to observe the procedure from the surgery side of the “curtain” and so I was given clear instructions as to where I could stand and what I was not allowed to touch. My general rule was “don’t touch anything” and I was fine. I was given permission to take pictures and videos throughout the procedure, at one point I was looking at my son leaving the uterus and not through the phone which prompted a staff member to ask me if they could continue taking the video while I continued to focused on the moment which I will be forever grateful for.  
We then returned to the Labor Ward  
Sadly, shortly after being congratulated by a senior nurse, we were confronted about suspected Data Protection infringement.  
They went on to explain the following:  
• We were not given permission to take pictures/video in theater without consent of everyone involved. This is strange as this was strongly encouraged by the team in as well as a letter sent by the NHS beforehand. Members of staff even assisted in taking the videos.  
• Insisted that I remove all videos/images in full view. Knowing the law myself, in order to settle the situation, I unwillingly showed all our photos and videos to prove that they consisted of my wife’s body and NHS hands which should infringe no laws as no faces were shown.  
• Mentioned that it was members of the surgical team who made the complaints. This is not the case as we personally spoke to the surgeon who had no issue with it.  
• Claimed that they have never heard of anyone taking videos/images in theater. This is strange to us as during a previous birth at this hospital, and this time, it was under general anesthetic, I was not allowed to be in theater, the team was all to happy to take a video of the procedure on our behalf, a positive gesture we applaud.  
• Then mentioned that there is an administrative process that we needed to follow beforehand. If this is the case, to avoid unnecessary confrontations, I suggest informing all future parents of this procedure. Regardless, this was an emergency C-Section, not sure how we would have completed the administrative process even if we knew the process.  
We felt belittled in front of two other team members (this was not even done in a private environment). This is such a pity as this ruined our moment especially after the trauma my partner had just gone through and she still hadn’t met the little one she had just delivered.  
Back to Positives:  
The doctor did two debriefings, I personally would love to invite for tea one day, post Covid-19, as they are such a lovely individual to be with and we couldn’t have been luckier to have this doctor bring our child into this world.  
All team members were AMAZING throughout our stay!To sum up, I honestly thought we would never have a better experience at BGH then our first child’s birth, I now stand corrected, not only were we blown away by the professionalism of each individual, we were BOTH treated like guests in a five star hotel.

author: rxxhxm
title: Some of the team
body:
Depending on who you speak to the Crisis Team has been either very supportive, or at worst, hostile, rude, impatient and making us feel we don’t deserve their precious time. Given that the people ringing them will be feeling distressed, possibly suicide, in a lot of emotional pain, the team has not shown us a lot of understanding that we may be finding it difficult to find the words we need.  
The first seemed to have no concept of how difficult it is to go through a trauma and how much courage I needed to ring up because I was nervous as to what to say and how to say it. Some of the team at Mansfield have been just what I needed. They’ve spoken to me respectfully and gently, with kindness and great understanding. Why can’t all the Crisis team members be as helpful as them? A patient shouldn’t self harm or experience even lower self esteem as a result of speaking to someone who is meant to help them but has made them feel like dirt. Thank you to those of you who are caring and compassionate. I hope the others of you come to realise.  
I called Nottingham City crisis team and I told my trauma to the person and all the person told me was that I need primary help (Therapy, counselling) which I have already done, and said I need to google how to cope and how to reduce my anxiety and take medication to control my anxiety and distract myself. These are the worst advice I have ever had and they made me feel way worse and made me feel like my problem it's not worthy of the time.  
I was told to go on a walk, ride a bicycle, go swimming to distract myself, however I have tried every single thing they have recommended and yet they still told me to be patient. I am feeling way worse after the call and I feel like I've just wasted my time and their time and they have belittled my trauma. Now I feel way more likely to self harm to reduce my pain because no one else around me wants to help me and been turned down by the crisis team.

author: conditionerkm57
title: Very good all round
body:
:) Very good all round  
Surgical-Gastro-Endo

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Treatment at A&E
body:
I would like to thank the A&E department at the S.W.A.H.  
I had what I can only describe as a very bad abscess that affected me in more ways than just pain.  
After contacting a local dentist, I was informed they would ring me back ( I’m still waiting ).  
As my face had begun to swell my wife rang the doctors and was told I had to go to the hospital.  
When I arrived at the hospital the A&E department was busy, the notice board stated 6-8 hours waiting time.  
After a while I was called to be assessed then returned to waiting area.  
I can’t deny the waiting time was long and I was listening to quite a few people complaining.  
When It was called for my turn I was taken through and checked.  
I had X-rays taken/ blood test taken / and was given pain medication.  
All the time I was at the hospital I was treated with such care and attention and respect by every member of staff.  
Though people may have to wait to be seen and it may take a long time, the care you will receive is worth far more than the time it may take.  
Once again THANK YOU A&E staff.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Caval
title: Care for people with long COVID
body:
I am concerned over the lack of care for individuals with long COVID within Forth Valley. I have heard that Forth Valley had plans to to address this months before and had released a press statement to this effect.  
I am aware other health boards are providing care and support for people with long COVID. I have had no success in my attempts to gain information via various avenues. I feel very disappointed that I am now over 5 months with this condition with no support and no hope that this is going to change.

author: monocerosew47
title: Family Footprints
body:
Family Footprints with Sahra  
I found this course amazing and very inspiring listening to other people in the same boat as me who have been going through similar experiences. Would definitely recomment to anyone struggling on their own. THERE IS LIGHT AT THE END OF TUNNEL!  
Sahra is fantastic!!

readBy.name: Caroline Dinenage's Office, MP for Gosport

author: Private1267
title: Inpatient experience
body: I was admitted with severe migraines — spent 10 days as an inpatient. It took three days for me to have an MRI. Some healthcares were rude to me, and acted inappropriately — rolling eyes when I said I was in pain & making out I was not being honest. Some nurses would deny my medication when I requested more pain relief, even though I was able to have a stronger relief. It was 10 days as a nineteen year old without my mum, I requested support for my anxiety and feel like I’d been lied to over certain things — being told my bloods were clotting in accident and emergency, but then being told they was fine?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: IanS21
title: Issues with hearing aids
body: Had issues with hearing aids and although had to wait a bit for appointment on the day it was a very good experience and I came away with two new hearing aids as even listening to their loop system it was obvious I needed them.

author: romeoew84
title: Last to get pain meds
body: Excellent care. Only one thing, I was in a side ward at the end of a ward and last to get pain meds at night. Sometimes it was 11pm before I got them

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: doradoyz67
title: They were my support
body:
Can't fault S.T.A.R.S. when I ask for help they were all over it.  
My life had become uncontrollable my family life was been affected, I did not care for living anymore. I reach out to S.T.A.R.S. the staff there were there for me through out my recovery. Anyone who went to come out of addiction, need support S.T.A.R.S. were my support and can open up different paths to be known to me.

author: defenderhx38
title: They are always there
body:
My life was out of control the drinking had taken over.  
After a few false starts, I managed to get a little clean time, then from there a little more. (a day at a time) S.T.A.R.S. are always there and offer something new to work and think about.

author: cassiopeiaky94
title: I was sick of being sick
body: I came to a point in my life where I was just waking and baking, in and out of prison. Sick of being sick and tightened my life began to make a little sense when I reach out and got myself on a script, I am still on my script. But with a clear goal in my heart

author: chassismw89
title: Coronary
body:
Five Stars +++++  
Bright caring Staff (ALL)  
Felt reassured  
Nothing could have been better

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Teddy2015
title: My Dads stay on the ward
body: My elderly dad was admitted to ward 55 after a fall. Through his stay he was treated with great care and kindness. After initially finding communication difficult with the staff, Andrea got involved and from there I felt fully in the loop and reassured. It’s difficult when your loved one is in hospital especially in these Covid times and so I am all the more appreciative of all the staffs hard work and dedication.

author: Pinkumbrella
title: ABC PIP SEHSCT, an invaluable service.
body:
I am currently pregnant with my 4th child and have been able to use this service through both this and my third pregnancy. It is an invaluable service that has helped me bond with my babies during pregnancy and after helping me feel more confidence, supported and empowered through the entire maternity experience. I feel it has been extremely beneficial service in providing me with the additional support I need at a time when I feel more vulnerable, anxious and less confident than usual.  
Being able to talk to Janine or Bronagh about any worries, concerns or barriers I face helps to provide a sense of security and provides a continuity of care that isn't always achievable in the typical maternity care framework. It has worked well alongside other perinatal mental health care I have received. They were able to run zoom courses such as mellow bumps which was amazing as it again provided support but also helped provide a sense of connection and reduced the isolation associated with pregnancy during the coronavirus pandemic. It provided a place to discuss concerns, feelings and ideas with other mums and form peer support.  
Even having previous children being able to bounce of the ideas and concerns of others in a safe place was amazing and helped alot to alleviate anxieties and stress. The ABC PIP service is just amazing for providing the extra support that some people need in the transition to parenthood and Janine and Bronagh do a wonderful job in delivering the service in both a professional yet fun, friendly and caring way.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Annd70
title: A hysteroscopy procedure
body:
I was greeted at the door by Lynn one of the service’s nurses, she was just lovely and very reassuring as I had contacted them in advance as I was extremely anxious to have the procedure, she put me at ease and explained that there was no pressure to have it done that day but that the consultant Dr Ducach would discuss everything with me fully beforehand. He did this in a sympathetic manner, allaying my fears and instilling confidence in myself that under his guidance I might manage to go through with the treatment.  
The procedure was over within an hour, charge nurse Siobhan was on hand as were Lynn & Yvonne (my gas and air angel), with encouraging words and kindness at all times. Dr Ducach talked me through the whole procedure so I was aware of what was happening at all times.  
I cannot speak highly enough of the experience I had whilst in their care, the nursing staff and my consultant were just lovely, the department exuded kindness and professionalism, I will now not be worried to go back to their clinic for further procedures as my experience was so positive. If you are sent to this Perthshire clinic please be reassured that they will put your needs first and that you could not be in safer hands.

author: cafeyk93
title: Put me at ease
body: I attended for removal of a lesion from my ear. David and Lee-Ann introduced themselves and what they were about to perform. Gave a full and informative explanation and then proceeded to carry out the minor procedure. I felt no pain and it was over in twenty minutes. They put me at ease and chatted away informally but professionally.

author: Maryp55
title: Very smooth operation
body: I received my vaccination this morning at RVH vaccination centre. It was a very smooth operation and although I was a bit apprehensive, I quickly felt very comfortable & safe. The operation was very slick and the teams were so experienced and welcoming. Every element of my vaccination was handled superbly from the person who greeted me at the door, to the admin teams checking and verifying identity; to the reassuring vaccinator nursing teams (smiling behind the masks) and admin team giving me a smile with my card on the way out. Super efficient!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lizzie2222
title: Excellent service and kindness
body: Very pleased with the service that Torrington DTU provides, excellent service and kindness, needs well attended to throughout my treatment and I would never dream of going anywhere else for my treatment just exceptional and thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Midwife57
title: Health Care Assistant’s
body: After visiting the unit for nearly 2 ½ years twice a week I am extremely pleased with help that the train nurses and Health Care Assistant’s have helped me. it is lovely to meet other patients being treated at the same time as me, especially during lockdown. Facilities are good and there is always somebody to make us a tea or coffee and a biscuit, the area is always hygienic and comfortable.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Katieclaremc
title: District nurse care
body:
District nurse Sharon came out to my father's house as he had a blocked catheter.  
She was so helpful and kind and sorted out the problem very quickly.  
We ae so grateful for her lovely care and want to say thank you.

author: coordinationen69
title: Coil fitting
body:
Needed to have my coil changed, it had been difficult to find a service that had availability.
The team I met were very professional and everything was explained to me before the procedure. After the procedure I was issued with advice and guidance.

author: looks like could not care less
title: Alzheimers
body:
my late wife was diagnosed in november 2015. we had approx 4 visits from team at kelso hospital then for at least the last 3 years we got no contact. this last 2 years I have had to part dress her do the washing cooking cleaning.  
I would like to know why the team stopped contact. we were from a generation that never begged for help. even a phone call during the last 3 years would have kept the team up to date. please let me have a reply thank you

author: KJS
title: Irregular heart beat
body: I woke up on Tuesday morning sat down to do some meditation and felt uncomfortable. My heart beat felt odd. I had to stop my practice. I called the doctor and he advised to go straight to A and E, which I did. From the moment I arrived I felt supported. I am not going to make this some long winded read. Suffice to say that every member of the staff at Lagan Valley hospital were quite frankly fantastic. I was so frightened of what might be happening and every member of staff was reassuring and caring. From the cleaning staff to the consultants every one just seemed that nothing was a problem everything they did they did with care and attention. I think this is world class service but even beyond that I feel that to be in this line of work you have to be a special caring person and every member of staff at LAGAN VALLEY hospital has all the credentials. Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart you are all amazing. God bless you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kw12
title: Check up
body: Amazing, very comfortable and welcomed

author: Tennispm82
title: Day Surgery Experience
body:
I attended Torbay Day Surgery Unit for a small urological procedure, the procedure itself was carried out well and I am recovering well at home with no complications.  
The care I received before and after surgery left a lot to be desired.  
I arrived at 7:45am, as instructed, but had to wait outside in the cold until 8am with 7 other people, also waiting. When booked in, I was told to get changed into a gown but the gown I was given only had 1 tie on...I didn't ask for another one because luckily I took my own dressing gown. However had I have not had my own dressing gown I would have felt extremely embarrassed.  
After the procedure, I was taken back to a cubicle where I expressed the need to go to the toilet. I asked 3 different nurses, on 3 seperate occasions to fetch me a bottle but each time my request was unfulfilled. I was extremely desperate and sadly due to not being given a bottle, I had an accident and urinated over myself and the bed, which was extremely embarrassing.  
Despite being a gentleman of 82, I am still very independent and always manage to make it to the toilet at home and wait if out and about. I wouldn't have needed any help to use the bottle so it would have taken no time at all to fetch one for me, especially as I was unable to get up out of bed after my procedure.  
I am extremely disappointed with the lack of care, attention and respect for my dignity on this occasion. I feel that having to ask twice was bad enough, but three times is absolutely unacceptable and what happened as a result should never have been allowed to happen.  
Further to this, I felt that my discharge took a long amount of time and this made an already poor experience more difficult. One part of my medication I was due to take home was also missing.  
Overall, despite the procedure going well, for which I am very grateful, it has been overshadowed by the poor care I received.  
Please ensure that this doesn't happen again so others people don't need to suffer the same indignity I had to endure.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

author: pagerrj54
title: Excellent experience
body: We are writing about our video appointment this week which was efficient and although apprehensive initially it was much less stressful than attending in person.   The consultation itself with David was superb.   We are very grateful and understand the capacity issues you have as we look forward to starting treatment when the treatment slots become available.

author: JCalikes
title: Paediatric Continence Service
body:
I spoke with a nurse at the service, where my child is a patient, having been referred around two years ago. My child has night time incontinence and uses incontinence pads to protect their mattress at night time. I enquired as to whether we could be provided with these from the NHS as they have a medical need for them and they are rather expensive. The nurse advised me that these could not be provided due to my child having no issues with daytime continence and that if they were incontinent and soiling during the day, products could be provided by the health board for both daytime and night time incontinence but that if the patient only has night time incontinence products cannot be made available.  
I am struggling to understand the rationale for this and therefore, I would like someone from the health board to come back to me to help me understand.  
In addition to this, the nurse advised me that the paediatric incontinence service is no longer operating from clinics in the Camglen (Rutherglen and Cambuslang) area. This is very inconvenient for families living in the area, particularly those who, like myself, do not have a car. My child has autism and therefore, the enuresis clinic is not the only medical appointment that they are required to miss school (and I work) to attend. Travelling on public transport to a clinic in Blantyre or East Kilbride, means that we will miss an entire session of school and a morning or afternoon of work as opposed to an hour if the clinic was closer to home. I would ask that the decision to remove clinics from Camglen be reconsidered.  
Kind regards

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: zebrazg69
title: Everyone was so kind to mum
body: A word of thanks to the A&E staff in SWAH especially to Janine, Alanah and helper Caroline. They were fantastic looking after my mother who broke her hip on thurs evening. And a big thanks to Radiographers Damian and Julie-Ann who do a excellent job. Everyone was so kind to mum and we are so grateful for such wonderful staff.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lack of correspondence
body:
I had my annual review in January which involved bloods being taken for analysis. I was told I would receive a text message with the results but still waiting. I have tried to contact the surgery via telephone and been unable to get a reply. I’ve tried using the ask my gp service but it is frequently unavailable because it’s disabled due to demand. My login for this service is now also disabled and despite trying to phone to reset I again can’t get through to speak to anyone who can help with this problem. 
It would appear that I am not the only patient with a problem getting in touch with a doctor or health care specialist so I hope this is going to be sorted quickly.?

title: Worst doctors I’ve ever been at
body: Nosy admin staff change your prescriptions, doctors are rude and don’t listen but talk over you. Weeks before you can get phone appointments and no empathy at all from any of them. Terrible experience every time I have to deal with them and can’t change due to post code, it’s a joke!

author: Mumofgirls
title: Positive birth experience at Aberdeen Midwife Unit
body: In September 2020 I gave birth to my 2nd daughter in Aberdeen Midwife Unit. It's long overdue, but I wanted to thank all those involved in the delivery of my little girl. I felt very well looked after during labour from the first phone call to inverurie midwife unit for reassurance, to the triage care I received at Aberdeen. Hannah in midwife unit along with HCSW made the birth of my 2nd daughter a very postive experience for me and my husband. I felt listened to and cared for throughout, and due to this our daughter is now called named after her. Thank you, all the staff in the matty were amazing!

author: SJF
title: I needed help
body:
I needed some help to help me start processing things that have happened and I got that help when I self referred for counselling  
My counsellor, Leanne, helped me to see different things and listened to whatever I spoke about and she helped me to find some perspective to things which was great and it has helped me continue finding perspective and working through my issues

author: glenarriff
title: Excellent service
body: received 2  vaccines. excellent service. Thank you.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Angdc62
title: Breast Cancer Journey
body:
I went for a routine mammogram when screening resumed late August 2020. I was recalled to breast screening clinic in Nelson Mandela within 2 weeks for further investigation. Was seen by MrMcKirdy the following week & breast cancer diagnosis confirmed. Options discussed & decisions made on next steps.  
Met my breast care nurse Alison who followed up each step as promised. Mastectomy done in October at RAH Paisley. Further tests carried out & thankfully no chemo required but some radiotherapy at Beatson end of November.  
My next appointment now October 2021. I cannot thank or praise each & everyone within NHS who looked after me during this time. I have laughed & cried with some of them as they saved my life despite the craziness of a worldwide pandemic. I was always treated as an individual but more importantly, they treated me with respect. God bless them all....not all superheroes wear capes, I know that from first hand experience x

author: travellerqq47
title: My care for lymphoedema
body:
Although I have told my story over the phone, I can repeat all the services I receive are all second to none. Nothing could be better.  
The drivers are brilliant and the nursing staff I have, usually the same sister are 11 out of 10.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: clear and quick communication
body: We have recently moved to the neighbourhood and have been interacting with the Higham Hill medical centre via email and SMS. They replied to the messages promptly, were very quick to sign us up and immediately sent us link to sign up for the Covid-19 jab.

title: Excellent quick and efficient service
body: I have been very happy with this GP surgery. Friendly and informative receptionists. Telephone and face to face appointments offered at appropriate times when I have needed and seen very quickly. Very happy.

title: Friendly staff
body:
Extremely friendly helpful staff.
Would recommend to everyone,  can't praise them enough. 
Well done

author: DownMan
title: Kind and thoughtful care for my sister's Covid-19 vaccination
body:
My sister is significantly sight impaired, has a mitral valve issue, osteoporosis, and several allergies for which she has to carry two epipens at all times.  
Because of this her GP communicated with the head of the vaccine programme at the Ulster Hospital (Craig) to see if she would be able to have a vaccine - which she definitely wanted to have if possible. It was agreed that she could but it would have to be administered in the hospital in case she took a negative reaction to it.  
I am her only brother and because of previous strokes need to use a rollator, so I was accompanying her on the day.  
On the day, perhaps because of my visible disability and my sister's white cane, we were fast-tracked through the triage process despite the fact that there were around 40 people in the queue ahead of us.  
After a brief wait we went in to the nurse, Julie, who after listening to the list of my sister's issues and especially because of the allergy aspect went and brought in a doctor to talk with her.  
This doctor (Dr Drew) was very easy to talk with, most reassuring, and set out the pros and cons of the situation for my sister. She also suggested that after getting the vaccine it would be advantageous to sit for 30 minutes instead of the usual 15.  
After getting her vaccine, Julie very kindly aided my sister along the corridor to a chair and gave instructions to others to keep an eye out for her. We have nothing but praise for both Dr Drew and Julie Chambers for their professionalism and genuine care.  
We also want to thank trainee nurse Asha and nurse Lee who were very diligent in making sure that my sister was OK and getting her a drink of water as she was very warm - the hospital was hot that day. Lee especially checked with us and kept us right on the time we were sitting.  
After the final paperwork was dealt with at the counter she took us outside by a shorter route. Our thanks to her and the other nurse.  
My sister's next appointment for the 2nd vaccination at the end of May will be at the SSE arena in Belfast, which if I am being honest will be more difficult for us to get to, as neither of us find public transport the easiest to use.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A wonderful service and dedicated team?
body:
I attended the practice this morning for minor surgery, and as always found the team both professional and caring. This friendly team deserves so much praise, which at times, is lacking from many who are to quick to criticise, and slow to praise.
The doctor and nurse who carried out my procedure was first class, with a caring attitude, and ready to take the time to explain what was going to take place.
Although the procedure was minor, it was carried out with care and totally painless.
Doctor’s surgeries are under extreme pressure at the moment, so please, be patient, and be supportive.

title: Terrible service
body: Took two days to get to speak to someone then told to book video call. The first available one was 4 days later. Told by doctor on video call l needed to see a doctor which was obvious in first place. Was told doctors would call me next morning to make appointment. No one called so l called the surgery in afternoon. Been in queue for over hour then got to caller one ringing ringing and no one answered waited 20 minutes. What a shambles. And do not want to hear COVID excuse doctors should get back to work and see patients, it’s just an excuse now.

author: romeozf37
title: Appointment
body: I was told my daughter needed a 6 and 12 month review however 10 minutes before the appointment I got a call to say this was not required and it was a mistake. I had to take a morning off work for this appointment and it was not required.

title: Receptionists should not give out results to…
body:
I recently picked up a hospital investigation report from the practice.  When I rang some weeks ago to be given the result, the receptionist told me it was 'quite normal'.  On collection, I find that it isn't, & that some action is recommended.  This is the second time this has happened to me - the first time was with a blood test.  Luckily, a doctor rang some time after the blood test, but I've not yet had any contact following this report - maybe because a doctor I have never seen is the one to have read it, not the doctor who sent me.
How is it that receptionists are allowed to read and 'guess' the relevance of  the content of these reports?  They are not medically trained and obviously have no idea what they are looking at?  Why are telephone consultations with a doctor not given in order for results of investigations to be given?  Receptionists are obviously not capable of dealing with medical matters or terminology and this practice should cease.

title: Parsonage Surgery - could not be better!!
body:
My ear infection started on a Saturday night. By Sunday afternoon it was painful. I chose the e-consult option Parsonage Surgery have made available via their website. Easy to use, available out of hours and very analytical. 

By 10.00AM Monday morning the Surgery had reviewed my case and prioritised a Rx, which was sent to my (also excellent) Pharmacy. On top of that the Doctor sent me a message of further support if need be. I commenced treatment by midday Monday.

Could not be better, thank you Parsonage Surgery.

title: Great service
body: Great service at the practice as had to bring my son in after a telephone conversation with the doctor as he was coughing so much. I am glad that he got to see a doctor as he had a nasty chest infection  Thank you to all the staff and receptionists for always answering all queries in these difficult times.

title: Cant get appointments, no different than pre-covid
body:
Try for an appointment, hours waiting on the phone for a queue of just 2 people (again!).
No appointments anyway so have to do the same tomorrow. Try doing this if you are a WORKER or at SCHOOL. Someone in that practice does not listen to common  sense.
Even if one manages an appointment it will be a telephone conversation with a nurse. What a complete waste of time.

title: Highly recommend
body: I have had to visit this practice regularly this last month and have only experienced professionalism, courtesy and knowledge.

title: Terrible Reception
body: I was on the phone for just under an hour and 20 minutes to speak to someone in reception, was 9th in queue. How does it take 1:20 to answer 9 calls?!? And I could hear a second receptionist in the background too... What exactly are they doing when my call took literally 2-3 minutes? When I have been at the practice I do see them chatting and ignoring ringing phones and now I see why it took so long for my call to be answered... That is absolutely unacceptable.

title: Just awful
body: Let's leave aside the fact that this surgery was incapable of providing the necessary information about my health for to my life insurance provider, and the fact that 2 years on they have still not sent off a simple form to the council to allow them to collect clinical waste from me, the pharmacist cut my prescription quantity without consulting or even informing me by half. When I then went to reorder after half the time I usually would, they rejected it. But they didn't see fit to tell me that. In the DR IQ app my repeat request was marked as approved. So I only found out that my prescription was rejected when I went to the pharmacy to collect my medication. By this stage on a Friday afternoon it was too late to do anything, so I went through the weekend with no medication. On Monday morning I rang the practice, but the pharmacist doesn't work Mondays. So I have to go yet another day without medication. This is a Kafkaesque display of such gross incompetence. Any other surgery must be better than the Lister. It's worth getting on a 45 minute bus if you have to, just don't sign up to this absolutely shambolic surgery whatever you do.

title: Extremely disappointed and quite concerned
body: Submitted an eConsult did not get a response, submitted the “I am still waiting” form and to my surprise a further day later I find myself still waiting for a response. Tried calling but can’t get through. I thought eConsult was supposed to speed up access to Doctors. Obviously at Lilliput Surgery this is not the case

author: Hayley000
title: Recent Colonoscopy
body:
I had a recent Colonoscopy. The staff were great and my experience overall was very positive.  
During the procedure it was very difficult for the staff involved to get the camera round part of my colon and I was aware of heavy pushing on my body. A number of times I had to reposition myself to try and allow access for the camera. Unfortunately, this did not work and the camera was unable to access part of my colon. This is not a complaint directed at the staff as I realise they were trying their best for me. Following completion of the procedure, I left the department very sore and had quite severe sciatica, in my left leg and 8 weeks on I am still taking prescription painkillers with costly physio appointments. I'm also finding it extremely painful to sit at my desk job. Like I said, I don't want this to come over as a complaint, I just wanted to share my experience of the procedure and I totally understand that there is a possibility of these things happening.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: capellard
title: Great experience at Patrick Clements Sexual Health Clinic
body:
I visited have visited this clinic three times now for vaccinations and STI tests. I have multiple chronic conditions, so I see a lot of nurses, doctors and healthcare facilities, and honestly this is the most welcoming centre with the nicest staff I have ever seen in a healthcare setting.  
I am used to normally having to stand up for myself and having to be assertive when it comes to my health and access to services, however at this clinic, I have never felt like this is needed. The staff here are always openly enthusiastic about seeing me and are very good at explaining complicated medical concepts to a layperson. The are very good at forming a trusting relationship with me as a patient, and I always leave this clinic with a smile and a warm feeling inside.  
I would particularly like to thank nurse Joycelyn and doctor Fahad for their great service and advice. In my pre-appointment screening call, I also spoke to another doctor who seemed very caring and whose advice was very helpful - I think her name might have been Martha. Please pass on my thanks to all of them.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: violetsf65
title: Colposcopy
body:
Today I went for a Colposcopy after my cervical smear test showed abnormalities. I was extremely nervous for this procedure and didn't know what to expect. However, the care I received was exceptional, the nurses and consultant were so supportive and encouraging making my experience quick and easy.  
The staff were lovely! Wendy came to collect me from the waiting room and made me feel immediately at ease. I was then introduced to Jen and Miss Kangeyan who went through the procedure and the results process in a way that was clear and easy for me to understand.  
When the procedure was taking place I felt extremely comfortable and looked after, even in the more painful moments.  
Each step of the way, I felt well informed about what was going on and my worst fears about any further treatment have been relieved! I can't thank the nurses and consultants enough!

author: lionsm98
title: referral from gp
body: I was referred by my gp after two years of a problem with the skin on my fingers that I cannot resolve. ,   Feel really disappointed at the service I received at clifton.   I was rushed in and out in literally five minutes they told me there was little they could do as they were a wart virus but growing near my nail abnd I would have to continue treating them at home.   This is impossible every time I try to use the gel I literally bleed for hours.   I have tried everything at home and this was my last hope.   They did the liquid nitrogen but this was rushed and I was out the door and given a questionnaire to fill in.   I feel like they just didnt want to bother but this issue is affecting my mental health.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: volansxe36
title: An abdominal aortic aneurysm
body: I want to thank Mr Pherwani, his team and the anaethestists for their expertise in operating on my aneurysm. I, my wife and family were reassured by the manner in which I was treated and the explanation we were all given before the operation. The nursing staff were wonderful. I can’t thank everyone involved enough.

author: JD1992
title: What person centred care is all about
body:
I attended all my antental appointments with the Community Midwives in Banbridge Health Centre.  
The midwives that i had were Mabel, Christine, Diane and Yvonne. They were all fantastic. I looked forward to every appointment.  
At each appointment they checked in on me and how i was coping with pregnancy as this was my first baby. They were thorough with checking baby, making sure they got a clear heartbeat, checking baby's growth etc which was always reassuring.  
As this was my first baby i always had lots of questions and they always took the time to answer them or explain things i didn't understand.  
As baby was did not arrive on the due date, i was offered a routine sweep and i declined on the first occasion. Diane respected that decision and did not make me feel pressured to have this done. Instead we had a chat about it and made a plan. This is what personal centred care is all about.  
Mabel, Christine, Diane and Yvonne gave me the highest standard of care and i always left every appointment feeling reassured and content that my pregnancy was going well.  
They are a credit to the Southern Trust, they are fantastic midwives!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: echokh75
title: Our Rainbow after the storm - amazing obstetrics care
body:
In the summer of 2018 my son Findley was stillborn, followed by the late miscarriage of my daughter, Robyn in 2019, when I fell pregnant again in 2020, with my son I was terrified.  
I was under the care of obstetrics consultant Dr Crichton, she had investigated my sons death, and supported me through then loss of my daughter. The support I received during my pregnancy was amazing, from the extra reassurance scans, to the weekend visits to triage unit for reassurance CTGs, any questions I had every staff member took the time to explain fully the answers to me and my husband.  
The staff were fantastic, and they all took the time to know my history. I never felt like I was a bother, and nothing was every to much. It was fantastic to have had such person centred care, which included the effect that my previous obstetrics history would have on my mental health during my pregnancy. Especially when lock down came around and my husband was no longer able to support me at scans, we understood fully why I had to go alone but there was always time to get my husband on the phone so he could hear everything that was being said.  
My son was born happy and healthy in September 2020, via a planned controlled c section after being breach, preformed Dr Crichton, along with the same midwife who had delivered my son in 2018, Senior Charge Midwife Racheal. The theatre staff again all took the time to reassure me and answer all my questions.  
My care after my son was born was also second to none, Midwife Sophie in Ashgrove had started my induction with my son Findley in 2018, and it was amazing to have her care for me and Lewis during my stay after my section, we had a stay of 7 days after my son was born, it was hard being away from my friends and family, but again my mental health was well looked after, and i felt supported.  
Our journey was not an easy one, but we will forever be thankful to the teams who cared for us, and showed us amazing support.  
Unfortunately I had complications post section which results in two further stays in AMH, again the care was amazing from the obstetrics teams. I have worked in healthcare care for over 15 years and I have never met such amazing supportive staff, especially senior Medical staff.  
A special mention to Dr Crichton, SCM Shewan and Midwife Sophie, in addition to all the teams in Triage Unit, ANC, Ashgrove Ward and Summerfield. Thank you!!

author: Macyg38
title: Thankyou to all the staff
body: Thankyou to all the staff at Rvh vaccination Centre. So well organised and  clean. 👍

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: 2nd Time Mum
title: My birth experience
body:
After reading some of the reviews regarding other women’s birth experiences at Newham Univesity Hospital, I was pretty nervous. However, my overall experience was actually really positive.  
I’m not going to lie, not being able to have your partner stay overnight to help fully support is pretty tough - especially as nights with a newborn are long and you sometimes need that reassurance when you’re not sure what you’re doing! At the moment though, visiting times to the post-natal ward are 9-5pm. I really do hope this changes soon and birth partners are allowed to stay during the night. That said, all the midwives I had supporting me were lovely. And after having a planned c section, where I wasn’t able to get out of my bed, they were always quick to respond to my call button. Special thanks to my midwife Kemi, and the rest of the team, including the lovely student midwives I met. My planned c section was also a lot calmer than I was expecting and the entire team in theatre were fantastic and really made me feel at ease.  
This was my second time giving birth. My first experience was elsewhere and I can honestly say my overall experience at Newham was better. My antenatal care was predominantly with a named midwife at the Barking Birth Centre which was fantastic and I had a great midwife (Beth).  
Towards the end of my pregnancy, I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes and this is where the care maybe lacked a little, particularly with regards to one consultant who left me in tears. However that is the only negative I can say about my entire experience at Newham Hospital.  
So for anyone else about to give birth at Newham, please don’t worry yourself too much with all the negative birth stories from Newham. Everyone’s experience is different and I hope yours will be just as positive as mine.

author: Ben093
title: Stroke
body:
I had an intracerebral haemorrhagic stroke with Ventricular extensions. I spent the first two weeks in the QEUH, then I was transferred to the RAH.  
I have no memory of the first 6 weeks of my stay in hospital, but it’s when my true journey began.  
I couldn’t walk, talk, or swallow, it was everything in baby steps. The staff there I hold in the highest regard, everyone from the cleaners to the doctors. To this date I’m forever in their debt.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: aferg
title: The highest levels of empathy, kindness and patience
body: I had to attend A& E with my 18 month old after she slipped coming off a trampoline and couldn't weightbear. Every single person we came into contact with had the absolute highest levels of empathy, kindness and patience with us. From the nurse who assessed us at the door to the happy nurse who saw us in the waiting room to assess for head injuries. The consultant who went out his way to bring my daughter juice when she said she was thirsty and the radiographers who allowed me to wear a lead coat and gave her stickers. As it turns out my daughter had a fracture on her ankle. This was dealt with quickly and she was fitted with a moon boot. The whole experience was patient centred and holistic. The staff also cared for myself. I was so so grateful for the care shown to me and my daughter which in my mind went above and beyond call of duty. Thank you.

author: Kerry1984
title: Reassurance & support
body:
I had my baby in February this year and was lucky enough to have access to the Fife Breast Feeding Support Service. Following a c-section, due to a breech baby, I found breast feeding challenging as she was a very sleepy baby for the first 24/48 hours, which I think may have affected how quickly my milk came in. I also struggled to get a good latch with her and suffered from severe nipple trauma which subsequently resulted in an infection.  
Having additional support at home was so important to help me to continue breastfeeding when it became very difficult, and gave me the reassurance & support I needed .

author: Theadventuresofjam
title: His support has been so valuable
body: My health visitor came after I had baby in lockdown. It was pleasant surprise to see he was Male. Kyle was and still is extremely supportive to myself and my kids. I feel totally at ease with him and I know if I have any concerns I can just pick up the phone to him. The last year hes supported me and my kids through difficult times due to the breakdown of my marriage not once has he judged me. He knows my kids will always first. His support has been so valuable everyone needs a kyle as a health visitor. I am so grateful for him and I hope he never leaves us. Huge thanks for all your help and for helping us grow as little family.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lexhj64
title: AstraZeneca vaccine
body: I Went to Gilbertson Park in Lerwick on Wednesday 21st for my second doze of the vaccine. I was really impressed with the layout and the professional way the staff operated. I felt safe and made at ease.

author: Srfz
title: Great experience
body:
To preface this; I have social anxiety and dental phobia. I have not had any work done in an extremely long time due to this and had very badly damaged teeth.  
The staff in here were extremely welcoming and made me feel at ease. Even though I managed to have a bit of a panic attack just before the surgery they were calming and empathetic.  
This turned what I foresaw as an absolute nightmare into the closest thing I can call to a pleasant experience when requiring surgery; haha.  
Directions where clear, I was asked several times if I had any questions at multiple points. Each step was gone through with me; I woke up and did not feel even a quarter as bad as expected.  
Great experience from someone terrified of dentistry.

author: Gregg011
title: Toenail removal
body:
Was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The procedure was ok, a bit of pain when was being numbed. Was warned about this and nurse insisted on holding my hand!  
The two (David and Lee-Ann) were a comedy double act and talked me through the procedure from start to finish. All in all very quickly done and communication was always given and any questions answered.

author: 1234abcd
title: Excellent care
body:
My daughter was admitted to Ward 2C for treatment of a UTI, obviously we were beside ourselves with her being only a few weeks old but all the team in 2C were excellent.  
I especially want to thank our nurse Nicki, such a caring person who was just so down to earth. I'm sure you were sick of my life story by the end of your shifts but you were so friendly and honestly felt like a friend at an anxious time.  
We hope to not see you again but wish you all well x

author: atlasnb69
title: I really appreciated the friendly and helpful staff
body:
I attended the vaccination centre. From entering the car park the whole experience was well organised and ran smoothly. Instructions were given in a clear and friendly manner.
There was a short wait in a queue outside. Plenty of hand sanitising and a lot of helpful staff.
There were no major delays and I left feeling well informed of what to expect in terms of side effects of the vaccine.
I really appreciated the friendly and helpful staff which made this a good experience.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: emmemmcee
title: My treatment today
body:
I set out this morning to walk 20 miles on the Kiktwalk from Kilbryde Hospice. Fell off the pavement within UHH grounds injuring my ankle and knee and ended up at A&E. I was helped out the car by SAS staff Alison and George and if they hadn't come to my aid I might still have been in the car  
Thank you both  
I just want to thank the whole A&E team but special mention to the lovely receptionist, Kerry on triage, John the x-ray porter ,Lauren in X Ray and the wonderful nurses Debbie and Nicola. They appreciated that I was in severe pain and were caring, compassionate and sorted me out very efficiently. Thanks to Nicola who walked me slowly to my husband. I couldn't sit on the wheelchair if you paid me as I was still too frightened to sit down  
From a COVID-19 perspective the department was scrupulously clean. Well done Team A&A.  
Thank you for your help this morning.  
.

author: millimeternm45
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A brilliant service to offer
body:
The virtual Visitor helped me set up a video call from my own phone, she demonstrated how to connect to the internet and allowed me time to note it down so that I can do it again myself.  
I was able to connect a video call with my daughter and see my grandchildren, it was fantastic as it's my grand daughters birthday today. I am so grateful to have seen my family, I think this is a brilliant service to offer.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: HappyHamish
title: Dizziness & vomiting
body: Very many thanks for the swift & direct telephone help from Dr Glenfield in BECS last night who listened & responded to my concerns, and then to all the nursing staff & Dr Hume for very efficient & safe care in the Emergency Department. 3 hours from phone call to home again, including the necessary CT scan. Great job everyone! - we are grateful to you all -

author: millimeternm45
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great to see my family on the video
body: It has been great to see my family on the video. I have been in hospital over a week and I look forward to the calls each evening.   Even chatting with the video call facilitator is lovely, they are very friendly and I enjoy seeing my family.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anniejohn
title: So easy and professional
body:
This service is excellent and vital to patients families . Dominik and Tara both made it happen for my elderly father to have a call. My dad does not use a mobile phone and we were very worried about not seeing him.  
Dominik made it so easy and professional. Excellent service to have in these times. Massive thank you to Tara for the booking and Dominik for  
Making it happen to see our daddy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Maysie
title: Care of 84 year old diabetic mother with cardiac failure.
body:
Feel very comfortable with all aspects of district nursing provided.  
Professional friendly and reassuring.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Maysie
title: Excellent patient care and respect.
body:
My mother was admitted to Coronary Care Unit in Antrim. Sister Quigley’s team provided outstanding nursing care together with respect, care and reassurance for both their patient and the family.  
I cannot speak highly enough of this ward and all staff who made a difficult time for us as easy as they could. 10 out of 10. Truly thankful.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Christyallan
title: Extremely helpful and efficient staff
body:
I have had both of my vaccines now and the staff at Dunfermline church have been extremely helpful and efficient.  
It's been a pleasure speaking each person from the minute I got there. Even the people taking your information and wiping the seats.  
I can imagine it's a very long day each day and they all seem to still have a smile on there face and happy to say hello, or a minute to talk to you.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Abundance
title: Forever Grateful
body:
Thank you NHS for saving my life.  
I’ve been a doctor for 17 years and it was now my time to be a patient. I’ve never felt more grateful and proud of you ward 4 PRI. Inspired, thankful, and overwhelmed by kindness.I wish to extend my sincere gratitude to the amazing team of colleagues who looked after me during my week long admission as a patient (April 2021.) As a consultant receiving care, it has reinforced how immensely proud I am of the acute medical receiving ward at PRI and how well you look after patients, now reflected by my own first hand experience. More than 42 individuals were involved in looking after me from door to door and although I cannot mention everyone by name, you all know who you are and how you’ve helped. I am forever grateful. The care and attention of the nurses in such a busy department was exceptional (special mention goes to Pauline, Jean, Mingle, Gemma, Tia, Robyn, Sophie(bank nurse) Emma, and Laura.) To the health care support workers (Edna and Teresa) and domestics (Audrey, Kerry, Kathy), thank you for ensuring my comfort. To my fantastic medical colleagues for the wit, humour and generosity alongside top notch clinical acumen. Thank you to my consultant Dr Harper and for the kindnesses of all my consultant colleagues who took the time to check in on me from point of admission through investigation to departure -this meant more to me than you can imagine and I’m so very thankful for your time (Dr Williamson, Dr Al-Khairalla, Dr Clark, Dr Sloan, Dr Cadden, Dr Jordan, Dr Habicht, and Dr Currie.)To all the porters especially Dennis( thanks for the lemon drizzle chat) and Alec for cheerfulness as you go about your day, thanks for all that you do. To Cairstiona physiotherapist( I hope this spelling is correct!) thanks for getting me back on my feet. To Carol and David our administrative team thank you. Finally to the radiology and laboratory services, your contribution hastened diagnosis. Thank you. Special thanks to our junior medical staff: Dill, Verity, Ali Baird, Barry and Matthew, who took time to have banter alongside day to day medical tasks. It made what could have been a potentially isolating time, a time of comfort. I am forever thankful and proud to see you all blossoming.  
With immense gratitude.

author: hippoyg37
title: Outpatient Appointment
body: I attend the air lab in Daisy Hill Hospital SHSCT this morning for lung function tests. I feel so welcome, safe and the staff were so friendly the hospital was spotless with clear directions of were to go and the Respiratory technician was in full PPE. She was friendly welcoming and reassuring and put me at ease while undertaking the tests. Helen make me feel safe and went above and beyond to ensure I didn't have to touch any surface I didn't need to. Excellent service with professional staff. Thank you

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Colourful Lady
title: Helpful, friendly and professional
body:
Today I went for my second COVID vaccination at the clinic in the South Lake Leisure Centre. All the staff and volunteers were helpful, friendly and professional. The centre was spotlessly clean and well organised.
My appointment was at 1510 and I was seen on time and left at 1530 (after the required 15 minutes wait after the injection).
The leisure centre itself has ample parking and is easy to get to by car.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: CDerm77
title: Excellent care
body:
I've been a dermatology patient across two health boards for 17 years, and I work in health care.  
I had a routine appointment on Friday as a check up for my regular treatment, but have been experiencing a new and different skin complaint.  
I saw Dr Muthiah, who listened to my concerns, examined the skin changes and took a thorough history. She explained what she thought the most likely cause was and asked her colleague to confirm. They were in agreement, and carefully explained the problem, the treatment options, timescales and a back up plan for me.  
I felt very much reassured and well cared for. As a patient who has lived for many years with a chronic disease, it's so beneficial to have the care of an expert team who take the time to listen and to explain, and take concerns seriously.  
I was impressed and relieved by Dr Muthiah's care, and that of the nurse who took my bloods.  
I was in and out of the dept in 20 minutes too.  
I'm very grateful for this service, thank you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: LIzzy Mc
title: Fantastic service
body:
The service was fantastic it was so smooth so professional and so Easy I arrived at the Ulster hospital well signpost to the Covid car park  
Lots of helpful people pointing the way  
The process was so well run I was so thankful I lived in Northern Ireland and we had so many able people to run this service  
Thank you NHS

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: footballem58
title: Great care
body: Got the first astrazeneca vaccine, feel great, didn't even feel it going in. Brilliant stewards, admin and nursing staff. Very good set up.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: intensityrs75
title: Excellent patient care
body:
The lady giving me the vaccine was so pleasant and friendly. She offered great advice and made the whole experience an absolute joy!
Her name is Olivia in Craigavon centre.
The whole system is well organised and I felt very safe the whole time.
I would like to express my appreciation to all involved!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very attentive doctors
body: Very thorough service, ie explores and explains to patient all possible avenues available to patient based in symptoms. Thank you

title: Lucky to have you
body:
I recently had to attend several appointments at the Hadleigh Practice. I was truly impressed by the patience and professionalism shown by the three doctors I saw.  Each possessed a wealth of experience and having served Broadstone residents for a combined total exceeding sixty years. Although my health issues were relatively minor, at no time was I made to feel silly or less important. The practice itself also works in a most efficient manner. 
I therefore just wanted to convey my thanks to the the doctors, nursing staff and the receptionists for their dedication and hard work in these challenging times and recommend the Hadleigh Practice to any potential new patients.

title: Light therapy Basford
body:
great service and great staff everything disscused and questions answered.
easy place to find good parking flexible time slots

title: Great practice
body: Always reassuring and pleasant when I have attended the macular clinic, staff are great,very friendly

title: burn dressing
body: Nurse practitioner look after my burns well and healed within 2/52 with good results, clear instructions how to care the burn wound at home how to avoid further injuries to the wound

title: The most amazing treatment
body: I cannot say enough good things about Talk Wandsworth. I’ve had treatment with them multiple times over the past three years including CBT for anxiety, and grief counselling. I’ve never had to wait longer than ten weeks for an appointment and the therapists are so knowledgeable, kind and empathetic. Talk Wandsworth has always been there for me throughout my mental health struggles and traumatic life events, I don’t know what I would have done without their support. Last week I attended a virtual workshop with them and after discussing my difficulties I was immediately referred for a triage. NHS mental health support is incredible and Talk Wandsworth has the best treatment I have ever experienced.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: Superb service for the Covid Vaccination
body:
Well done for the excellent service at The Civic Hall for the Covid Vaccination . Brilliant service at Kiltearn Medical Centre very well organised 
A huge shout of thanks to everyone there
